captions:
TRIP TO FLORIDA, via the GREAT SMOKIES
Gordon Landreth and Paul Kreider - --- -- - 1932
Visiting nine states: Pennsylvania, Maryland, West Virginia, Virginia, Tennessee, North Carolina, South Carolina, Georgia, and Florida.

CROSSING THE GREAT SMOKIES from Gatlinburg, Tennessee
Twelve miles of steady climbing on gravel road cut from the sides of the mountains. No fences, with sheer drops of hundreds of feet over the side. At many places it was impossible for cars to pass. We encountered no more than a half dozen cars on the whole trip to Bryson City, N. C.

Twelve miles of steady climbing on gravel road cut from the sides of the mountains. No fences, with sheer drops of hundreds of feet over the side. At many places it was impossible for cars to pass. We encountered no more than a half dozen cars on the whole trip to Bryson City, N. C. 1931-1939 courting&marriage_Page 01.jpg

captions:
NANCY KREIDER LANDRETH
Born Friday, November 24, 1939
2:20 A. M. Lanc. General Hospital
Weight - 7 lbs., 4 oz.
Height - 18 4/5 inches
Doctor – Marvel S. Kirk, M. D.

Two weeks old - on way home from the Hospital.
Two weeeeweee kks cold -- on way home hoomme ffrommm the Hoosssppital,

captions: Covered bridge over the Conestoga near Eden. Note the almost perfect reflection in the water.

Bleak farm land in November. Looking north from the New Holland Pike in the direction of Hunsicker Mill.
Landis Valley Museum where are preserved many of the articles of every day life in the early days of the county. The street car, shown at right, made its last appearance in 1947.
WHEATLAND, home of James Buchanan, seventeenth president of the United States. Located on Marietta Avenue.
